text: Colombia was at the Olympic Games in 1932 for the first time. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Colombia is COL. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== Teams from Colombia have been in all but one Summer Olympic Games since then, missing only the 1952 Games. Colombia was in the Winter Olympic Games in the 2010 Winter Olympics. Colombian athletes have won a total of eleven Olympic medals in six different sports. Mar√≠a Isabel Urrutia won the nation's first gold medal in 2000.
